description: Celts are a versatile civilization that excels in infantry and siege warfare, with a focus on wood gathering and economy.
dark_age: Start with 6 villagers and a scout.
Build 2 houses, a mill near berries, and a barracks near forests.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 21-22 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 400-500 wood, and 50-100 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 6-7 villagers to food, 6-7 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 1-2 to stone.
feudal_age: Build additional barracks and continue producing infantry units.
Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade infantry and sell excess resources for gold.
Build a stable and train scouts if necessary.
Advance to Castle Age at around 28-29 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 1000-1200 wood, 500-600 gold, and 200-300 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 12-14 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 3-4 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
castle_age: Build a siege workshop and start producing siege weapons.
Build a monastery and start training monks.
Research the unique technology, Stronghold, for improved castles.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 36-37 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3500-4000 food, 2500-3000 wood, 1000-1200 gold, and 800-1000 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 22-25 villagers to food, 20-22 to wood, 5-6 to gold, and 5-6 to stone.
imperial_age: Train woad raiders and siege weapons for a powerful army composition.
Research the unique technology, Furor Celtica, for improved infantry speed and attack.
Use monks to convert enemy units and siege units to destroy buildings.
Assign 40-45 villagers to food, 30-35 to wood, 10-12 to gold, and 10-12 to stone.
